column4: i have a very old palm m130, i want to read text files on it, what encodings do i need
they have their own format. but you can use jpilot and its utilities to send and recieve palmdoc files from the device
jpilot isnt working
i have the cradle and the usb connection to the computer
are you able to hotsync the device?
yes but only on windows
im on ubuntu lucid
have you played around with the "sync port" settings yet?
should have had this problem last week before my m130 died on me :P
to try and make it work yestreday, i dont even remeemberdsprc:  ummm, maybe i did so many tweaky thing
you can try to 'dmesg | tail' and see if its being recognized
i did the "press the hotsync button" -fu but it never worked
assuming everything is kosher, you sometimes have to be ninja on the hotsync and press it from the palm first, then quickly again in jpilot
also, i have a crapload of text files sorted into many different folders, what will make them readable on the palm, wi\th minimal garbage chars due to encoding probelms?
are you using a specific reader or just Memo on the palm?
umm how would i use memo on the palm
you just import them in the palmdoc format and $DEITY willing they automagically appear there
what palmdoc format
can memo read sd cards?
it should be able to (IIRC) by ticking the menu at the top right and selecting the card. havent used the m1xx series i years tho.
youre better off getting a dedicated reader though. http://www.memoware.com/mw.cgi/?screen=help_format
